questions.question: What term refers to the changing magnetic field within a coil that induces an electromotive force (EMF) in another coil?
What is the formula for calculating the total capacitance in a series circuit of capacitors?
options: The product over the sum of capacitances
The reciprocal of the sum of the reciprocals of each capacitance
questions.correct_answer: The reciprocal of the sum of the reciprocals of each capacitance

What phenomenon causes a change in the direction of light as it passes from one medium to another?
What is the unit of magnetic flux density in the International System of Units?
What term describes the phenomenon where the phase velocity of light or other waves in a medium is dependent on frequency?
What is the unit of inductance?
Which of the following electromagnetic waves has the highest frequency?
Which principle states that every point on a wavefront may be considered a source of secondary spherical wavelets that spread out in all directions at the speed of light?
